when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used to greet someone during the day.
example: こんにちは、元気ですか？ (konnichiwa, genki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to say goodbye, often for a long time.
example: さようなら、また会いましょう！ (sayounara, mata aimashou!) - Goodbye, let's meet again!

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the morning.
example: おはよう、今日も頑張ろう！ (ohayou, kyou mo ganbarou!) - Good morning, let's do our best today!

when_to_say: Used to say good night before sleeping.
example: おやすみ、良い夢を！ (oyasumi, yoi yume wo!) - Good night, sweet dreams!

when_to_say: Used to agree or confirm something.
example: はい、わかりました。 (hai, wakarimashita.) - Yes, I understand.

when_to_say: Used to disagree or deny something.
example: いいえ、違います。 (iie, chigaimasu.) - No, that's not correct.

when_to_say: Used to apologize or get someone's attention.
example: すみません、道を教えてください。 (sumimasen, michi wo oshiete kudasai.) - Excuse me, can you tell me the way?

when_to_say: Used to make a polite request.
example: 水をお願いします。 (mizu wo onegaishimasu.) - Water, please.

when_to_say: Used to respond to someone thanking you.
example: ありがとう！どういたしまして。 (arigatou! douitashimashite.) - Thank you! You're welcome.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone's health or energy.
example: 彼は元気です。 (kare wa genki desu.) - He is healthy.

when_to_say: Used when talking about eating food.
example: ご飯を食べます。 (gohan wo tabemasu.) - I eat rice.

when_to_say: Used when talking about drinking liquids.
example: 水を飲みます。 (mizu wo nomimasu.) - I drink water.

when_to_say: Used when talking about going somewhere.
example: 学校に行きます。 (gakkou ni ikimasu.) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used when talking about coming to a place.
example: 友達が来ます。 (tomodachi ga kimasu.) - My friend is coming.

when_to_say: Used when talking about seeing or watching something.
example: テレビを見ます。 (terebi wo mimasu.) - I watch TV.

when_to_say: Used when talking about listening or asking questions.
example: 音楽を聞きます。 (ongaku wo kikimasu.) - I listen to music.

when_to_say: Used when talking about writing something.
example: 手紙を書きます。 (tegami wo kakimasu.) - I write a letter.

when_to_say: Used when talking about reading something.
example: 本を読みます。 (hon wo yomimasu.) - I read a book.

when_to_say: Used when talking about speaking or having a conversation.
example: 日本語を話します。 (nihongo wo hanashimasu.) - I speak Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when talking about studying.
example: 毎日勉強します。 (mainichi benkyou shimasu.) - I study every day.

when_to_say: Used when talking about working.
example: 会社で働きます。 (kaisha de hatarakimasu.) - I work at a company.

when_to_say: Used when talking about playing or having fun.
example: 公園で遊びます。 (kouen de asobimasu.) - I play at the park.

when_to_say: Used when talking about sleeping.
example: 早く寝ます。 (hayaku nemasu.) - I sleep early.

when_to_say: Used when talking about waking up.
example: 朝早く起きます。 (asa hayaku okimasu.) - I wake up early in the morning.

when_to_say: Used when talking about buying something.
example: 本を買います。 (hon wo kaimasu.) - I buy a book.

when_to_say: Used when talking about selling something.
example: 車を売ります。 (kuruma wo urimasu.) - I sell a car.

when_to_say: Used when talking about making something.
example: 料理を作ります。 (ryouri wo tsukurimasu.) - I make food.

when_to_say: Used when talking about using something.
example: パソコンを使います。 (pasokon wo tsukaimasu.) - I use a computer.

when_to_say: Used when talking about waiting for someone or something.
example: バスを待ちます。 (basu wo machimasu.) - I wait for the bus.

when_to_say: Used when talking about meeting someone.
example: 友達に会います。 (tomodachi ni aimasu.) - I meet my friend.

when_to_say: Used when talking about returning home.
example: 家に帰ります。 (ie ni kaerimasu.) - I return home.

when_to_say: Used when talking about starting something.
example: 仕事を始めます。 (shigoto wo hajimemasu.) - I start work.

when_to_say: Used when talking about finishing something.
example: 授業が終わります。 (jugyou ga owarimasu.) - The class finishes.

when_to_say: Used when talking about thinking.
example: 問題を考えます。 (mondai wo kangaemasu.) - I think about the problem.

when_to_say: Used when talking about knowing something.
example: 答えを知っています。 (kotae wo shitteimasu.) - I know the answer.

when_to_say: Used when talking about understanding something.
example: 日本語が分かります。 (nihongo ga wakarimasu.) - I understand Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when talking about teaching something.
example: 英語を教えます。 (eigo wo oshiemasu.) - I teach English.

when_to_say: Used when talking about learning something.
example: ピアノを習います。 (piano wo naraimasu.) - I learn piano.

when_to_say: Used when talking about memorizing something.
example: 単語を覚えます。 (tango wo oboemasu.) - I memorize vocabulary.

when_to_say: Used when talking about forgetting something.
example: 名前を忘れました。 (namae wo wasuremashita.) - I forgot the name.

when_to_say: Used when talking about searching for something.
example: 鍵を探します。 (kagi wo sagashimasu.) - I search for the key.

when_to_say: Used when talking about finding something.
example: 答えを見つけました。 (kotae wo mitsukemashita.) - I found the answer.

when_to_say: Used when talking about holding something.
example: 荷物を持ちます。 (nimotsu wo mochimasu.) - I hold the luggage.

when_to_say: Used when talking about putting something down.
example: 本を置きます。 (hon wo okimasu.) - I put the book down.

when_to_say: Used when talking about opening something.
example: ドアを開けます。 (doa wo akemasu.) - I open the door.

when_to_say: Used when talking about closing something.
example: 窓を閉めます。 (mado wo shimemasu.) - I close the window.

when_to_say: Used when talking about entering a place.
example: 部屋に入ります。 (heya ni hairimasu.) - I enter the room.

when_to_say: Used when talking about exiting a place.
example: 家を出ます。 (ie wo demasu.) - I leave the house.

when_to_say: Used when talking about standing up.
example: 椅子から立ちます。 (isu kara tachimasu.) - I stand up from the chair.

when_to_say: Used when talking about sitting down.
example: 椅子に座ります。 (isu ni suwarimasu.) - I sit on the chair.

when_to_say: Used when talking about walking.
example: 公園を歩きます。 (kouen wo arukimasu.) - I walk in the park.

when_to_say: Used when talking about running.
example: 毎朝走ります。 (maiasa hashirimasu.) - I run every morning.

when_to_say: Used when talking about swimming.
example: 海で泳ぎます。 (umi de oyogimasu.) - I swim in the sea.

when_to_say: Used when talking about flying.
example: 鳥が飛びます。 (tori ga tobimasu.) - The bird flies.

when_to_say: Used when talking about riding something.
example: バスに乗ります。 (basu ni norimasu.) - I ride the bus.

when_to_say: Used when talking about getting off something.
example: 電車を降ります。 (densha wo orimasu.) - I get off the train.

when_to_say: Used when talking about driving a vehicle.
example: 車を運転します。 (kuruma wo unten shimasu.) - I drive a car.

when_to_say: Used when talking about stopping.
example: 車が止まります。 (kuruma ga tomarimasu.) - The car stops.

when_to_say: Used when talking about turning.
example: 角を曲がります。 (kado wo magarimasu.) - I turn at the corner.

when_to_say: Used when talking about crossing something.
example: 橋を渡ります。 (hashi wo watarimasu.) - I cross the bridge.

when_to_say: Used when talking about climbing something.
example: 山に登ります。 (yama ni noborimasu.) - I climb the mountain.

when_to_say: Used when talking about descending something.
example: 階段を降ります。 (kaidan wo orimasu.) - I descend the stairs.

when_to_say: Used when talking about arriving somewhere.
example: 駅に着きます。 (eki ni tsukimasu.) - I arrive at the station.

when_to_say: Used when talking about departing from somewhere.
example: 空港を出発します。 (kuukou wo shuppatsu shimasu.) - I depart from the airport.

when_to_say: Used when talking about arriving at a destination.
example: ホテルに到着します。 (hoteru ni touchaku shimasu.) - I arrive at the hotel.

when_to_say: Used when talking about traveling.
example: 日本を旅行します。 (nihon wo ryokou shimasu.) - I travel to Japan.

when_to_say: Used when talking about staying overnight.
example: ホテルに泊まります。 (hoteru ni tomarimasu.) - I stay at a hotel.

when_to_say: Used when talking about returning home.
example: 家に帰ります。 (ie ni kaerimasu.) - I return home.

when_to_say: Used when talking about going back to a place.
example: 会社に戻ります。 (kaisha ni modorimasu.) - I go back to the company.

when_to_say: Used when talking about visiting someone or somewhere.
example: 友達を訪ねます。 (tomodachi wo tazunemasu.) - I visit my friend.

when_to_say: Used when talking about guiding someone.
example: 観光客を案内します。 (kankoukyaku wo annai shimasu.) - I guide tourists.

when_to_say: Used when talking about introducing someone or something.
example: 友達を紹介します。 (tomodachi wo shoukai shimasu.) - I introduce my friend.

when_to_say: Used when talking about explaining something.
example: ルールを説明します。 (ruuru wo setsumei shimasu.) - I explain the rules.

when_to_say: Used when talking about asking questions.
example: 先生に質問します。 (sensei ni shitsumon shimasu.) - I ask the teacher.

when_to_say: Used when talking about answering questions.
example: 質問に答えます。 (shitsumon ni kotaemasu.) - I answer the question.

when_to_say: Used when talking about speaking or having a conversation.
example: 日本語を話します。 (nihongo wo hanashimasu.) - I speak Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when talking about listening to something.
example: 音楽を聞きます。 (ongaku wo kikimasu.) - I listen to music.

when_to_say: Used when talking about reading something.
example: 本を読みます。 (hon wo yomimasu.) - I read a book.

when_to_say: Used when talking about writing something.
example: 手紙を書きます。 (tegami wo kakimasu.) - I write a letter.

when_to_say: Used when talking about drawing something.
example: 絵を描きます。 (e wo kakimasu.) - I draw a picture.

when_to_say: Used when talking about making something.
example: 料理を作ります。 (ryouri wo tsukurimasu.) - I make food.

when_to_say: Used when talking about breaking something.
example: おもちゃを壊します。 (omocha wo kowashimasu.) - I break the toy.

when_to_say: Used when talking about fixing something.
example: 時計を直します。 (tokei wo naoshimasu.) - I fix the watch.

when_to_say: Used when talking about cleaning something.
example: 部屋を掃除します。 (heya wo souji shimasu.) - I clean the room.

when_to_say: Used when talking about washing something.
example: 服を洗います。 (fuku wo araimasu.) - I wash clothes.

when_to_say: Used when talking about wiping something.
example: テーブルを拭きます。 (teeburu wo fukimasu.) - I wipe the table.

when_to_say: Used when talking about tidying up something.
example: 部屋を片付けます。 (heya wo katazukemasu.) - I tidy up the room.

when_to_say: Used when talking about organizing something.
example: 書類を整理します。 (shorui wo seiri shimasu.) - I organize the documents.

when_to_say: Used when talking about preparing something.
example: 食事を準備します。 (shokuji wo junbi shimasu.) - I prepare the meal.

when_to_say: Used when talking about starting something.
example: 仕事を始めます。 (shigoto wo hajimemasu.) - I start work.

when_to_say: Used when talking about finishing something.
example: 授業が終わります。 (jugyou ga owarimasu.) - The class finishes.

when_to_say: Used when talking about continuing something.
example: 勉強を続けます。 (benkyou wo tsuzukemasu.) - I continue studying.

when_to_say: Used when talking about stopping something.
example: 音楽を止めます。 (ongaku wo tomemasu.) - I stop the music.

when_to_say: Used when talking about stopping something.
example: 音楽を止めます。 (ongaku wo tomemasu.) - I stop the music.

example: 仕事を始めます。 (shigoto wo hajimemasu.) - I start work.

example: 授業が終わります。 (jugyou ga owarimasu.) - The class finishes.

example: 勉強を続けます。 (benkyou wo tsuzukemasu.) - I continue studying.

when_to_say: Used when talking about stopping something.
example: 音楽を止めます。 (ongaku wo tomemasu.) - I stop the music.
